content: create five charming floral squares each one is a tiny tribute to the beauty of nature and the sweetness of new beginnings - then join them together to grow your very own patchwork garden perfect for brightening your day and baby s stroller > this pattern is available as a free > crochet along at the link provided **a scraps of yarn project ** the perfect project to do to use up all your bits and pieces from your leftover yarn this is completely optional and it can be worked in coordinated colors **difficulty level | skills required** easy to intermediate basic stitches in simple variations simple repeats color changes shaping and finishing you will need to know basic stitches like single_crochet single_crochet and double_crochet double_crochet special stitches explained and provided in the instructions **materials** hook 4 00 mm g scissors yarn needle **yarn ** vinnis colours dk nikkim 100% cotton 700 grams/1666 meters/1834 yards weight dk 11 wpi 3 light 14 x 50g balls **colors ** a natural 2 x 50g b sunshine 1 x 50g c1 raspberry 1 x 50g c2 - pale lilac 1 x 50g c3 blue bell 1 x 50g c4 peach 1 x 50g c5 pink 1 x 50g d avocado 3 x 50g e fern 3 x 50g **yarn substitute ** using the same type of yarn throughout the project is recommended the pattern suggests dk yarn weight dk 11 wpi 3 light worsted but you are not limited to this type of yarn any yarn can be used if you take into consideration your sizing for the project will differ **gauge | gauge** gauge = square size = 4 inch / 10 cm counting your stitches will ensure a true success of this project **size** square size = 4 inch / 10 cm final blanket size including border - approx length & width= 24 inch / 61 cm remember if you use/choose a different yarn weight/hook size your blanket will be a different size **abbreviations us terminology** **pattern support** full pattern support is available from the joanita theron designs facebook group or/and joanita theron designs ravelry group please post a question in the group and remember to tag me i will assist as soon as possible or one of my members will gladly jump in to help for questions relating to permission or usage email joanita@creativecrochetworkshop com
